public class UnquotedCsvReader extends CsvReader
Parses a stream of simplified CSV information. This class does not handle quoted entries, so the records cannot contain the delimiter. The records also cannot embed a newline. This class is useful for handling CSVs that do not use CSV quote rules for records. It is similar to and derived from class CsvReader except for the lack of double quote handling.
Author:
jonathanl (shibo), ericg, roberts

  • Method Details

    • extractNextColumn

      protected String extractNextColumn(com.telenav.kivakit.core.io.LookAheadReader in)
      Read the next CSV column from the input stream. When exiting this method the input stream should either be pointing to a line end (0x0D), a column end (delimiter), or the end of the stream. This version ignores double quotes, so the records cannot embed the delimiter.
      Overrides:
      extractNextColumn in class CsvReader
      Parameters:
      in - The input stream to read data from pointing to the start of the CSV column.
      Returns:
      A buffer populated with the column data or null if no more data exists.

    • readColumn

      protected void readColumn(com.telenav.kivakit.core.io.LookAheadReader in, StringBuffer buffer)
      Reads a standard, non-quoted, CSV column. Note that when the method exits the stream should be pointing to the line terminator, 0x0A, or be exhausted. This version ignores double quotes, so the records cannot embed the delimiter.
      Overrides:
      readColumn in class CsvReader
      Parameters:
      in - The input stream to read from pointing to the start of the column.
      buffer - The buffer to be populated with the contents of the input data.
